<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Poison Coat](/Feats.aspx?ID=6385) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 210 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Poisoner](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=259)

**Prerequisites**
[Poisoner Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6382)

</column>

---

In nature, certain animals are covered in venomous spines, and just brushing against them can prove deadly. You expend a [contact](/Traits.aspx?ID=565) or [injury](/Traits.aspx?ID=635) poison and spend 10 minutes brushing that poison onto your clothing or weaving sharp, poisoned needles into the garment's fabric. You can have only one poison suffused into your clothing at a time. You can use the Once Bitten reaction while you have a poison suffused in this way.

**Once Bitten** <actions string="Reaction" />A creature adjacent to you hits you with a melee unarmed [Strike](/Actions.aspx?ID=2306); **Requirements** You have prepared your clothing to poison attackers; **Effect** The triggering creature is exposed to the suffused poison, and the poison becomes inert.
name: Poison Coat
